attributes.action: Reform Child Maintainance Service method of calculating payments
attributes.additional_details:
Change to use the non residential parents NET income not including bonuses or overtime. 
Using Gross income means that the non residential parent is expected to pay a percentage of money that has already been paid to HMRC through income tax. 
Bonuses are often not regular or one offs that should not be included. 
A non residential parents overtime pay should not be included. 
Contact cost should be deducted from the maintenance payments.
attributes.background: The method that the Child Maintainance Service uses to calculate how much non residential parent pays in maintenance is unfair and unjustified.

rejection.details:
The Child Maintenance Service allows for contact costs to be consider as part of a special expenses variance. You can find out more information here:

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/336663/variations-explained-paying.pdf 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
